text: Stoichiometric amounts of Ln(NO3)3*6H2O(Aldrich, 99.9%, metal basis), Ba(NO3)2
(Aldrich, 99+%), Sr(NO3)2 (Aldrich, 99+%), Co(NO3)2*6H2O (Aldrich, 98+%), and Fe(NO3)3*6H2O (Aldrich, 98%) were dissolved in distilled water with proper amount of glycine.
The solutions were heated up to 350degC in air and followed by combustion to form fine powders, which were calcined at 600degC for 4 hours.
The resulting powders were then grinded and calcined again at 900degC for 4 hours.
